page_summaries.content:
BZX84WCx-Q1 Zener Voltage Regulator Diode in SC-70
1 Features
• Total power dissipation: 360mW (max)
• Low I/O capacitance: 80pF (max)
• Low leakage current: 0.6µA (max)
• Tolerance: ±5%
• Temperature range: –55°C to +150°C
• AEC-Q101 qualified
• Leaded package used for automatic optical inspection (AOI)
2 Applications
• Voltage regulation
• Over-voltage protection
3 Description
The BZX84WCx-Q1 is a family of voltage regulating diodes in a SC-70 package. The diodes are available in Zener voltages ranging from 8.2V to 39V.

Product Summary.content: The BZX84WCx-Q1 is a family of voltage regulating diodes in a SC-70 package. It features a total power dissipation of 360mW (max), low I/O capacitance of 80pF (max), low leakage current of 0.6µA (max), and a tolerance of ±5%.
The BZX84WCx-Q1 Zener voltage regulator diode is designed for voltage regulation and over-voltage protection applications. It is AEC-Q101 qualified and has a temperature range of –55°C to +150°C.
The BZX84WCx-Q1 Zener voltage regulator diode comes in a leaded SC-70 package, which is suitable for automatic optical inspection (AOI). It is available in Zener voltages ranging from 8.2V to 39V.

Electrical Characteristics.content: 6.1 Absolute Maximum Ratings: This section lists the maximum allowable values for various electrical parameters such as total power dissipation, forward current, ambient operating temperature, and storage temperature. These ratings must not be exceeded to avoid permanent damage to the device.

6.2 Recommended Operating Conditions and 6.3 Thermal Information: These sections provide the recommended operating conditions, including forward voltage, operating temperature range, and thermal metrics such as junction-to-ambient thermal resistance, junction-to-case thermal resistance, and junction-to-board thermal resistance. These parameters are essential for proper device operation and thermal management.

6.4 Electrical Characteristics: This section lists the key electrical characteristics of the device, including zener voltage, zener impedance, reverse leakage current, temperature coefficient, and capacitance. These parameters are provided for various part numbers and operating conditions, allowing designers to select the appropriate device for their application.

6.5 Typical Characteristics: This section includes graphs and figures illustrating the typical behavior of the device, such as zener current vs. zener voltage, temperature coefficient, and power derating curve. These visual representations aid in understanding the device's performance and characteristics under various operating conditions.
